article.title: Centrifugally driven winds from protostellar accretion discs. I - Formulation and initial results

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the black area in the figure represent?
choices: The region where the wind launching criterion is not satisfied.
The region where the flow is super-Keplerian.
The region where the magnetic field lines become locally straight.
The region where wind solutions are deemed unphysical due to the mass-loading constraint.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the inset in the figure demonstrate?
choices: The angle between the magnetic and velocity field vectors along a magnetic field line.
The change in density with increasing height above the disc midplane.
The radial extent of the wind-launching region.
The radial dependence of the local mass accretion rate.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be observed about the radial distribution of the wind mass loss rate (dM_wind/dr) in both models?
choices: It is constant across the entire radial extent of the wind-launching region.
It peaks at the inner radius of the wind-launching region.
It is localized, with maximum output at intermediate radii.
It peaks at the outer radius of the wind-launching region.

multiple_choice_question.text: How does decreasing the mass accretion rate (M_in) affect the radial extent of the wind-launching region?
choices: The radial extent remains the same.
The radial extent initially expands, then decreases.
